abstract.text: Description of the Stock and Flow domain.

inlineContent.text: The Stock and Flow model domain (metamodel) recognises the following node
An amount (of a material) in a container, reservoir, or a pool.
Rate by which connected container is filled or drained.
Function defined by a set of points
Delay of a value by a specific number of time units
Visual output in a form of a chart with one or multiple series
The edges in the domain are:
Connection between an auxiliary and other computation node
The constraints that need to be satisfied:
Flow must drain (from) a stock, no other kind of node
Flow must fill (into) a stock, no other kind of node
Graphical function must not have more than one incoming parameters
Control binding’s origin must be a Control and target must be a formula node
Chart series edge must originate in Chart and end in Value node
The following example shows how to create a simple bank account model. First we
The nodes need to be connected:
Typically you would not be creating detailed models by hand like in the
above example. The purpose of the library is to provide functionality for
applications that aid in model design.
Flag whether the stock can contain a negative value
Flag whether the inflow of the stock is delayed by one step, when the stock is part of a cycle
Priority during computation. The flows are considered in the ascending order of priority
Constant or an auxiliary computation formula
Method of interpolation for values between the points
The only interpolation method that is currently available is
The only available type of delay output computation is
Control is a node that can be used by graphical applications to provide
user-interface for controlling values of other nodes.
Controls types are not currently specified.
Minimum allowed value of the target variable
Maximum allowed value of the target variable
Simulation node specifies characteristics of a simulation. There should be only
one node of this type in the design. If multiple Simulation nodes are present,
Simulation node is not required to be present, but might be in the future.
Number of steps the simulation is run (if not specified otherwise)

abstract.text: Poietic package for modelling and simulation
Compiler creates a compiled model, which is an internal representation of
a design that can be simulated.
